item.title: Live Updates: U.N. Urges Calm as Israel and Hezbollah Trade Fire
item.description: Israeli airstrikes pounded southern Lebanon after Hezbollah’s leader vowed retribution for the pager and walkie-talkie attacks. Lebanese officials said it was one of Israel’s heaviest bombardments there in months.

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy finally found a conspiracy theory even he can’t get behind - POLITICO
item.description:
1. Vivek Ramaswamy finally found a conspiracy theory even he can’t get behind  POLITICO

item.title: Washington and the West struggle for a way forward with Putin’s Russia
item.description: In the United States and Europe, there is growing uncertainty about how to counter Putin’s aggression without stoking a direct conflict with Russia.

item.title: Fears of chaos as Georgia election board considers last-minute voting changes
item.description:
Republican majority eager for hand-counts of voting tallies, which experts say are time-consuming and unreliable

The Georgia state election board is set to meet on Friday and consider another round of last-minute election changes that could cause delays and confusion after election day in a critical battleground state.

The Republican majority on the board is expected to approve a rule that would require three people in every precinct to check machine-vote tallies by hand-counting the election results. Voting experts have long warned that hand-counts are time consuming, costly, and less reliable than machines. It’s a process that nonetheless has been favored by conservative activists who doubt the results of the 2020 election.

Continue reading...

item.title: Harris to condemn Trump in Georgia after news of abortion-related deaths
item.description:
Vice-president to speak after news broke that two women died after being unable to access procedure legally in state

Kamala Harris will give remarks on Friday in the Atlanta area about Donald Trump’s role in the abortion bans that now blanket much of the United States, days after news broke that two Georgia mothers died after being unable to access legal abortions and adequate medical care.

In the weeks since becoming the Democratic nominee for president, Harris has made reproductive rights a central part of her campaign. She has toured the country to highlight the healthcare consequences of the 2022 overturning of Roe v Wade, which paved the way for more than a dozen states to ban almost all abortions.

Continue reading...

item.title: Labelling Trump’s lies as ‘disputed’ on X makes supporters believe them more, study finds
item.description:
Study says tagging posts with false claims on election fraud may make Trump voters more likely to think they’re true

Labelling tweets featuring false claims about election fraud as “disputed” does little to nothing to change Trump voters’ pre-existing beliefs, and it may make them more likely to believe the lies, according to a new study.

The study, authored by John Blanchard, an assistant professor from the University of Minnesota, Duluth, and Catherine Norris, an associate professor from Swarthmore College, looked at data from a sampling of 1,072 Americans surveyed in December of 2020. The researchers published a peer-reviewed paper on their findings this month in the Harvard Kennedy School’s Misinformation Review.

Continue reading...
